channel.title: Daily AI & Tech Digest
channel.description: AI-curated daily digest of podcast conversations about artificial intelligence, technology trends, and digital innovation.

item.title: AI Daily Digest: Sora 2 & Soares (Oct 1, 2025)
item.description: Sora 2 debuts with lifelike video, multi-shot control, and Cameo consent. Quick take: why identity, safety, and creatorship collide as AI video scales.

item.title: October 01, 2025: Movements in Action (Daily Digest)
item.description: Three powerful episodes on street-level care, moral ambition, and anti-repression—packed with practical steps for organizers and collaborators.

item.title: AI & Tech Daily Digest – Sep 30, 2025
item.description: Data-first prototyping, Gemini 2.5 GA, and the iPhone 17 redesign—fast, actionable insights for busy pros.

item.title: AI Daily Digest — Sept 30, 2025
item.description: Today: Claude Sonnet 4.5 debuts with autonomous coding, plus OpenAI Sora 2 rumors and a wave of AI-driven workforce shifts. Quick takes on cost-savings, policy nudges, and market moves for busy pros.

item.title: AI & Tech Daily Digest - Sep 30, 2025
item.description: Fast, firm insights for pros: AP2, MCP, YouTube AI tools, and enterprise-ready AI. Production-first trends shaping commerce, creation, and governance.

item.title: Sept 30, 2025: Meaning, Psychedelics & Spirituality
item.description: A quick dive into meaning, purpose, and integration across atheist, Christian, and spiritually informed views—plus practical tips for purposeful living and psychedelic context.

item.title: A True Warrior: Redhouse Book Tour Debrief (Sept 30, 2025)
item.description: Debrief of the John Redhouse book tour: elder-led, intergenerational organizing, and movement media as infrastructure—with actionable takeaways for community organizers.

item.title: Agentic Coding Matures: Async Interns (Sept 29, 2025)
item.description: A quick, sharp look at Devin’s async, repo-aware workflow and how it reshapes engineering toil for busy teams. From scoping with DeepWiki to PRs via Slack, learn the patterns that boost throughput.

item.title: Social Movements Daily Digest — Sep 28, 2025
item.description: Two episodes, one focus: how to build power with care. Film-as-education meets veteran organizing in Part 1—plus practical, weekly steps for busy professionals.

item.title: AI & Tech Daily Digest — Sept 27, 2025
item.description: Fast, data-rich snapshot: AI build-out, shadow AI risk, platform convergence, H‑1B fees, and TikTok policy. Perfect for busy pros needing actionable takeaways and risk-aware context.

item.title: Iboga Initiation Reflections — 9/27/2025 (Ep.129)
item.description: Inside Bwiti lines and village-led care: Paije West shares grounded reflections on lineage, safety, and surrender after Gabon initiations. A concise, respect-centered look for busy professionals.

item.title: Sep 27, 2025: Movements, Power, and Belonging (3)
item.description: Three-snippet digest on myth-busting, governance resilience, and anti-capture strategies for inclusive organizing.

item.title: AI & Tech Daily Digest — Sept 26, 2025
item.description: Friday briefing: sovereign AI, coding-model shifts, and the open web’s AI traffic reset—plus how to win with smarter GTM and security go-to-market.

item.title: Audiobook 03: Majoun & Manuscript — Sept 26, 2025</title>
item.description: A quick, insightful dive into a Tangier‑set Beats tale and the ethics of language, set, and storytelling in psychedelic culture—with practical prompts for daily integration.

item.title: People Power: Movements & Mutual Aid (Sep 26, 2025)
item.description: Three threads on how communities move resources, resist outrage, and center class care—with practical takeaways you can apply this week.

item.title: AI Adoption Lessons from 5000 Devs – 09/25/2025
item.description: Quick, actionable takeaways: what 5,000 devs say about AI adoption, plus a jaw-dropping video model and OpenAI’s 7 GW plan. Your sprint-ready briefing for decision-makers.

item.title: Sept 25, 2025: Solidarity over Nativism & Katrina’s Echo
item.description: Three sharp conversations distilled into practical organizing wins for today: diaspora solidarity, disaster capitalism’s lessons, and media power for civic resilience.
